about.title: About Sean Reed McGee

extendedBio.family: Married to Wileeta McGee at 22/19, has three daughters and grandchildren. Grew up in a single-parent household with his mother.
extendedBio.education: Graduated from Wagner College with degrees in Business, Marketing, and Management
extendedBio.earlyWork: Worked at McDonald's at age 13, learned 'clean as you go' principle
extendedBio.personalInterests: Loves working, family time, football, traveling, movies, reading, fitness. Devoted Miami Dolphins fan.
quotes: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
Gratitude can transform ordinary common days into thanksgivings.

achievements: C3 Board Member at Consumer Consent Council
Winner of 'The Heart Award' at AFFY Expo 2023
Dr. Walter S. McAfee Leadership Award recipient (2025)

blogPosts.title: Dr. Walter S. McAfee Leadership Award
blogPosts.excerpt: I am deeply honored to have received the Walter S. McAfee Leadership Award from the Zeta Epsilon Lambda Chapter of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc.
blogPosts.content:
I am deeply honored to have received the Walter S. McAfee Leadership Award from the Zeta Epsilon Lambda Chapter of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc. This award recognizes leadership and community commitment, including contributing to a scholarship initiative awarding $1,500 to five high school students in Monmouth and Ocean counties.

Dr. Walter S. McAfee was a pioneering African American physicist who made breakthrough calculations for Project Diana in 1946, enabling the first successful radar signals bounced off the Moon. His legacy continues to inspire future leaders and innovators.

blogPosts.title: MedCerts & FocusQuest Unite Empowering Minority Students in Health & IT Careers
blogPosts.excerpt: MedCerts and FocusQuest announce a partnership to provide minority students with access to healthcare and IT career training.
blogPosts.content:
MedCerts and FocusQuest have launched a partnership to provide minority students with access to healthcare and IT career training. The partnership focuses on supporting students from Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) and Minority Serving Institutions (MSIs), and has already supported over 80,000 African American students.

'We strive to connect minority students with exceptional health-industry education,' said Sean-Reed McGee, FocusQuest CEO. Robert Hiller from MedCerts added, 'We're thrilled to provide students with opportunities to pursue in-demand careers.'

The program offers flexible online certification programs in allied health and IT, provides nationally recognized certifications, and aims to address workforce shortages while creating pathways to stable, rewarding careers.

seoMetadata.title: Sean Reed McGee - Entrepreneur and Performance Marketer
